private_information: No meetings on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00
brian.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's availability and respects preferences.

private_information: Preference: avoid meetings on Monday after 15:30 if possible
billy.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's availability and respects preferences.

patricia.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's availability and respects preferences.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a consolidated schedule that finds a valid 30-minute meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 for Brian, Billy and Patricia, respecting hard conflicts and soft preferences and output a PDDL domain and problem targeted for the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: Meeting to schedule is 30 minutes long.
All participants must be available for the meeting slot.
Billy prefers to avoid meetings on Monday after 15:30 if possible.
There exists at least one feasible meeting time that fits everyone's current schedules.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert calendar assistant. Provide Brian's free time slots within the defined work hours as explicit time intervals and identify any hard conflicts and soft preferences. Do not produce PDDL.
analyze.prompt: Your name is brian. You are given the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->brian->private_information}. Your goal is {agents->brian->goal}. Provide a concise machine readable availability summary that lists free intervals within the work hours and marks any preferences. Do not assume additional information.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert calendar assistant. Provide Billy's free time slots within the defined work hours as explicit time intervals and identify any hard conflicts and soft preferences. Do not produce PDDL.
analyze.prompt: Your name is billy. You are given the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->billy->private_information}. Your goal is {agents->billy->goal}. Provide a concise machine readable availability summary that lists free intervals within the work hours and marks the preference to avoid meetings after 15:30. Do not assume additional information.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert calendar assistant. Provide Patricia's free time slots within the defined work hours as explicit time intervals and identify any hard conflicts and soft preferences. Do not produce PDDL.
analyze.prompt: Your name is patricia. You are given the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->patricia->private_information}. Your goal is {agents->patricia->goal}. Provide a concise machine readable availability summary that lists free intervals within the work hours and marks any preferences. Do not assume additional information.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator that must integrate participant availability and preferences and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep individual agent actions distinct if modeling multiple agents.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive the availability outputs from the participants: {availability_brian}, {availability_billy}, {availability_patricia}. Your task is {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and the environment init parameters {environment->init} to construct a PDDL domain and problem that models time slots and a 30-minute meeting requirement, encodes hard conflicts and soft preferences (preferences may be represented as constraints or metrics), and is ready to be solved by FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>. If some participant information is partial, integrate what is provided and do not invent unavailable facts.
